1.author: Brent Weeks
1.description: In our first episode we review of the recently released The Burning White by Brent Weeks and the rest of the Lightbringer series. This is a monumental series with some iconic moments and characters...but nothing is immune from criticism! We always start off without spoilers and transition into full spoiler chat.
1.title: Lightbringer + The Burning White

2.author: James Islington
2.description: The guys break down and review the first book in the Licanius Trilogy by James Islington. No spoilers here, just an overview of the exciting and promising debut novel in what we expect to be a landmark series.
2.title: The Shadow Of What Was Lost Review

3.author: James Islington
3.description: Need to remember the details of Licanius Book 1? We have you covered with a full book recap, hitting on all the big moments. Plus play along at home with trivia!
3.title: The Shadow Of What Was Lost Re-Read

4.author: James Islington
4.description: We recap the many, many plot threads of Book 2 of The Licanius Trilogy by James Islington. Give us a listen to catch up before reading Book 3 - The Light of All That Falls - which was just released!
4.title: The Echo of Things to Come

5.author: Netflix
5.description: I took a break from the books to watch Netflix's The Witcher. This review is from a book reader's perspective - and I'm happy to report it's a solid show that should have us all excited for the future of fantasy books coming to the small screen.
5.title: The Witcher Season 1

6.author: Brandon Sanderson
6.description: Hot takes abound in our review of Book 1 of Brandon Sanderson's Stormlight Archive. Apparently it isn't that hard to be a critic of THE landmark series of the past decade!
6.title: The Way of Kings

7.author: R. F. Kuang
7.description: No spoilers in our breakdown of the first book in a new and unique critically-acclaimed speculative fiction series from R.F. Kuang. We're excited to read more of this one!
7.title: The Poppy War

8.author: James Islington
8.description: The conclusion to the Licanius Trilogy was a mixed bag for us. Worth reading, but somewhat disappointing after the success of the first two books. Also, Stephen is a prose snob!
8.title: The Light of All That Falls

9.author: Brandon Sanderson
9.description: The machine that is Brandon Sanderson can write pretty high quality YA books as well. How does this series compare to his more prolific epic fantasy series? The guys have some positive comparisons, and deep cosmere lore. We liked the humor (mostly), but across the board struggled with the cheesy romance. Also, a deep dive into the psychology of 11 year-old Stephen's terror of basilisks.
9.title: Starsight

10.author: Liu Cixin
10.description: The Remembrance of Earth's Past series by Cixin Liu is a breakthrough sci-fi series that took our collective breath away. Translated from its original Chinese, the prose is sharp and perfectly displays Liu's imaginative yet haunting vision of a future after contact with an alien race. We discuss cultural differences, ethical dilemmas, and questions of what it means to be human. Also, a callback to some of our favorite childhood series. Finally, we cannot NOT recommend experimenting while reading the series!
10.title: The Three-Body Problem Trilogy

11.author: Brandon Sanderson
11.description: What is it exactly about The Stormlight Archive that so thoroughly captures our imaginations? We try to answer this question as we tackle the IT series of the fantasy book world. Our favorite moments & characters receive full coverage, but no series is perfect! Our new "worst of the best segment" at the end of the episode talks about a few not-so-favorite moments. Plus, what would it be like to dorm with Sanderson & Jeopardy! champion Ken Jennings?
11.title: Words of Radiance

12.author: Steven Erikson
12.description: Gardens of the Moon by Steven Erikson is the entrance into the epically long and complex Malazan universe. Our resident expert Ryan is on hand to guide Ben & Stephen through the book and chuckle about their misguided theories. We also discuss favorite scenes and characters and how the series compares to Sanderson's cosmere. Plus our Worst of the Best segment and the dangers of audiobooks and high ACT scores.
12.title: Gardens of the Moon

13.author: Jim Butcher
13.description: The first book of Jim Butcher's Dresden Files is a slow start to what will eventually blossom into one of our favorite series. This is urban fantasy done right! Dresden doesn't take itself too seriously and neither do we, with comparisons to Harry Potter and trashy romance novels. Plus, is male gaze a thing in this series, and how much of an issue is it?
13.title: Storm Front

14.description: Our first segment of Fantasy News is a recap of a momentous 2019. Game of Thrones went out with a whimper and The Witcher came in with a bang. The Boys, The Umbrella Academy, Watchmen and several Marvel offerings commanded our viewing attention. Our literary eyeballs saw Lightbringer & Licanius come to an end. Plus, we mix up heroine Starlight with Sanderson's newest YA offering and can't wait for Wheel of Time on Prime!
14.title: Fantasy News 2019 Recap

15.author: Pierce Brown
15.description: Red Rising is a classic mashup of The Hunger Games, Percy Jackson, Lord of the Flies & Ender's Game. However, this fast moving book is more than the sum of its parts. There are plenty of rough edges here as Red Rising sets up for the rest of the series, but overall we enjoyed the book and look forward to reading more Darrow! Also, who has time for camelCase during a podcast?
15.title: Red Rising

16.author: Fantology
16.description: We're looking ahead to a big 2020 of fantasy books, movies and TV shows. As always there are new offerings from Marvel, plus Amazon's Wheel of Time & Lord of the Rings adaptations. Sanderson's new Stormlight Archive entry headlines 2020's book releases, but there are a few others we'll be reading as well! Plus, when can we expect more Song of Ice & Fire & Kingkiller Chronicles and are the authors obligated to deliver?
16.title: Fantasy News 2020 Preview

17.author: Joe Abercrombie
17.description: The First Law Trilogy is the hallmark of grimdark fantasy. Gritty and hyper-realistic, this series is not for the faint of heart or weak of stomach. However, for those that have the fortitude there is a lot to love in the raw connection to characters & superb prose craft. This series is a new favorite - we're excited to read more Abercrombie! Plus, who is Louis XIV and where is France anyways?
17.title: The First Law Trilogy

18.author: Leigh Bardugo
18.description: This new dark fantasy book is the best urban fantasy we've read since Dresden Files. And that's high praise coming from Josh! The setting, characters and prose combine to form the beginning of a promising series that captivates the reader's attention from beginning to end. Plus, how come we missed out on joining a secret society in college?
18.title: Ninth House

19.author: Jim Butcher
19.description: If you like werewolves, you'll like the second book of the Dresden Files by Jim Butcher. This one is still a little slow with a simple plot, but it continues to build up towards the brilliance of the series that's manifest later on. Plus, some of us are unaware that werewolf is a real word with a canonized spelling. You learn something new every day!
19.title: Fool Moon

20.author: Andrzej Sapkowski, Przemysław Truściński
20.description: In this episode we review the entirety of The Witcher saga - video games, books & TV show. After the release of the Netflix show the books have had a huge surge in popularity and fans have been calling for another video game. Why has this series been so successful and what's the best medium for this story to be told in anyway? Plus, we apologize for knowing nothing about the noble country of Poland.
20.title: The Witcher Saga

21.author: Pierce Brown
21.description: No sophomore slump for Golden Son, the second book in the Red Rising trilogy! The middle entry continues to astound us with its unique formula of unforgettable non-stop action intermixed with poignant character moments. We discuss our favorite characters & scenes and speculate how Pierce Brown was able to keep the plot twisting and turning so effectively. Plus, yet another spelling error shames Fantology!
21.title: Golden Son

22.author: Robert Jordan
22.description: The Wheel of Time begins turning for us in our review of the first book of the series. These books are foundational in every sense of the word! Jordan built from Tolkien and then in turn has influenced the popular authors of today. Speaking of, how well does the series stand up when read 30 years after its initial publication? Plus, check out our Power Rankings of characters from the first book!
22.title: The Eye of the World

23.author: Philip Pullman
23.description: A steampunk, young adult & alternative universe setting is not our usual cup of tea in a book. But here it works, and works well. The His Dark Materials series is as enticing as it is controversial, and we discuss the nature of that controversy and how it should be handled as you read. There is some deep symbolism here with meanings which may be unsettling to some readers. Plus, looking for the best way to get rich as a kid and fool your grandparents?
23.title: The Golden Compass

24.author: Eoin Colfer
24.description: Blast from the past here! Artemis Fowl is going to be released as a movie soon so we thought we'd dust off our old copies and review it. This book (and series) was a huge hit in the early 2000's and still holds up well today. The characters are fun and the plot moves quickly. There's even some nicely executed twists at the end! If you never read this as a child, check it out now. Plus, look for Ben's new line of Mulch-inspired apparel coming soon!
24.title: Artemis Fowl

25.author: Michael J Sullivan
25.description: Ryan breaks down Michael J. Sullivan's first trilogy and does his best to convince Stephen to try reading it again. Sullivan pumps out a lot of content and is without a doubt the most prolific self-published fantasy author out there, but is the prose quality up to everyone's standards? Plus, comparisons to Wheel of Time, discussion on audiobooks vs physical books and several rash promises that one Fantology member may regret one day.
25.title: The Riyria Revelations

26.author: Philip Pullman
26.description: The second book of His Dark Materials keeps the momentum that started The Golden Compass going strong. This series has strong, unique character voices, engaging action, and meaningful symbolism. Although it suffers a bit from the classic second "bridge" book phenomenon, that by no means takes away from the quality of the series. Plus, looking to say fantasy books aren't of literary note? Bring it on!
26.title: The Subtle Knife

27.author: Fantology
27.description:
March was a great month for bad news, but there were a few nuggets of good news in the fantasy community! Josh, Ryan & Stephen recap and discuss recent tv, movie & book news in this episode. Beware, moderate spoilers if you aren't already current! Plus, Covid-19 bets that have aged poorly and moments one Fantology member doesn't want his wife to hear! 
 Topic tags: 
Stranger things 2:22 
 The Witcher 8:37 
 Wheel of Time 14:55 
 Poppy War 27:26 
 Dresden Files 29:51
27.title: March 2020 Fantasy News

28.author: Robert Jordan
28.description: Book Two of The Wheel of Time has an interesting structure. It's somewhat of a retelling of the first book, but it does so brilliantly, slowly fleshing out the world and larger plot of the series. Jake & Stephen break down the book without any series spoilers and first-time reader Kaden offers a unique perspective. The guys point out the important plot points and do a Power Ranking for their favorite characters. Which characters performed the best in this book alone? Plus, could the Dragon Reborn save the world from Covid-19 and a quick statistics lecture.
28.title: The Great Hunt

29.author: Jim Butcher
29.description: Jim Butcher is starting to find his stride in the third entry of the Dresden files. Ben, Josh & Stephen talk through the ghosts, vampires & fae and hype up the rest of the series! Important characters are entering and the seeds of huge conflicts have been planted. While this entry still has a ways to go in terms of quality of the later books, we are officially headed there. At least Fantology thinks we are. Plus, thoughts on vampires, nails from the Cross and attempts to pronounce the Latin name of a magical sword.
29.title: Grave Peril

30.author: J.K. Rowling
30.description: What else can we say about the GOAT series of YA fantasy? Stephen is joined by guest stars Dan and Nathan, who give their opinions on what makes Harry Potter what it is. We talk about some potential improvements to wizarding society, including issues with the house cup and Quidditch scoring systems. Plus, don't miss our power rankings of top and bottom character performances in the book!
30.title: Harry Potter And The Sorcerer's Stone

31.author: Philip Pullman
31.description: Some differing opinions on the conclusion of His Dark Materials make up Josh and Stephen's review of book 3. We tackle some controversial subjects, ingrained in the subject matter of the book. How does this series compare to other contemporaries, and what were some of our favorite moments from the book? Plus, what mythology features the River Styx?
31.title: The Amber Spyglass

32.author: Pierce Brown
32.description: The Red Rising trilogy concludes in epic fashion with this exciting and harrowing adventure. Ben and Stephen are on hand to provide a blow by blow of the fate of Darrow and the rest of the Rising. We discuss our favorite moments, including rocket launchers and razor fights. Plus, which Wheel of Time character is Darrow's plot eerily similar to? (Spoilers for the WoT series from 38:10 to 39:43)
32.title: Morning Star

33.author: Stephen King
33.description: Rather than cover the entirety of Stephen King's magnum opus, Stephen extracts a broad strokes overview of these books from Josh. Our expert just finished the series and obviously wants to say a lot, but holds back enough to give this episode a yellow spoiler rating. No specific plot points will be harmed by listening to this episode! Plus, comparisons to The Series of Unfortunate Events and how does it feel to be Stephen King?
33.title: The Dark Tower Series

34.author: Robert Jordan
34.description: Book 3 of The Wheel of Time takes the series to new heights according to our host Stephen, expert Jake & first-time reader Kaden. The guys provide their unique perspectives on the characters and plot as they break down the action from The Dragon Reborn. No series spoilers, but be prepared to hear all the details of this book! Plus, comparisons to The Ocarina of Time & Animorphs and too bad Rand Al'Thor never watched National Treasure!
34.title: The Dragon Reborn

35.author: Jim Butcher
35.description: The Dresden Files train continues to pick up speed for Ben, Stephen & Josh in the fourth book of the series. Summer Knight introduces the fae courts in force, as Harry once again is the only wizard for hire that can prevent the annihilation of Chicago. Faeries, vampires & wizards...oh my! Plus, Harry Dresden or Harry Potter, which series handles muggles better?
35.title: Summer Knight

36.author: Fantology
36.description: In this special edition Stephen, Ben and Josh supplement the low amount of news in Covid-19 April with their All-Time Top Five Fantasy Series Rankings. NO SPOILERS! Any book that makes a list like this is exemplary and deserves to be read, but with three different opinions on all time top five we couldn't help but drag each other's favorites through the mud. Just kidding... Kinda. Let us know what your favorite series are and where our opinions are completely off base! Skip to 9:00 for the Top 5 Series Rankings. Stephen: 1.Stormlight 2.Wheel of Time 3.Lightbringer 4.First Law 5.Kingkiller Ben: 1.Cosmere 2.Wheel of Time 3.Harry Potter 4.First Law 5.Red Rising Josh: 1.Mistborn 2.Harry Potter 3.Lord of the Rings 4.Dark Tower 5.Dresden Files HM: Gentleman Bastards, Farseer, Licanius, Stardust, Emperor's Soul
36.title: Top 5 Series Ranked + April Fantasy News

37.author: J.K. Rowling
37.description: Dan & Nathan are back to chat with Stephen and break down the minutiae of the Harry Potter-verse. Apologies for the significant audio issues, some hexes are so strong that not even post-production editing can fix them! However, persevere and listen to our takes on Lockhart, Quidditch broom imbalance, Ron's broken wand and the state of house elf affairs. Plus, Stephen's strange connection to de-gnoming.
37.title: Harry Potter And The Chamber Of Secrets

38.author: Joe Abercrombie
38.description: Joe Abercrombie continues to impress Ryan, Ben & Stephen with his first stand-alone novel, Best Served Cold. This is a brutal and bloody tale of vengeance crafted by a master storyteller. Not only does this book contain many memorable moments, but it also has us reflecting on the nature of good and evil and how we as humans deal with the tragedies of life. Our characters here don't necessarily deal with them well, as they're all tragically flawed although no less compelling for it. Plus, Cosca: lovable mercenary or mask-requiring wholesale conglomerate?
38.title: Best Served Cold

39.author: Jim Butcher
39.description: The fifth installment of Dresden Files introduces our favorite plotline and enemy yet: the Fallen Angel Denarians. These guys cause major trouble for Harry and Chicago as they threaten to unleash the literal plague across the world. No word if they had a hand in COVID-19. Once again, Dresden will have to rely on his friends and reach into his bag of tricks in order to save the world! Plus, book your tickets now for our Dresden tour of Chicago!
39.title: Death Masks

40.author: Brian McClellan
40.description: Blood of Empire concludes the second of Brian McClellan's two Powder Mage trilogies. Stephen and Ryan recap the first two Gods of Blood and Powder books before breaking down the exciting conclusion. If you're looking for a nice combination of military fantasy, political machinations and well defined magic all wrapped around a layer of frontier flintlock fantasy, then this is the series for you! Plus, it's usually a good thing when a book reminds you of Brent Weeks' Lightbringer series...right?
40.title: Blood of Empire

41.author: Jim Butcher
41.description: The sixth entry into the Dresden Files wraps exceptional character growth in a disappointingly adequate plot. The series is now set-up for explosive entries, but it took a few rough patches in this book to get there. However, there were some amazing and memorable moments too - who can't appreciate holy water balloons and vampire being crushed by frozen turkeys? Plus, Stephen & Josh's favorite Dresden moment is coming up in the next book. What will Ben think of it?
41.title: Blood Rites

42.author: HBO
42.description: HBO's adaptation of Philip Pullman's His Dark Materials got off to a fantastic start with a strong first season. Tune in as Josh and Stephen offer their opinions and reviews. The acting was memorable, the setting and filming was breathtaking and the budgeting was more than adequate! It's not Game of Thrones, but it's not intended to be. Instead the show was magnificent in its own right. Plus, the Lin-Manuel dream cast in the Kingkiller Chronicles TV show - who would he play?
42.title: His Dark Materials Season One

43.author: Fantology
43.description: The gang is all here! The full cast of the Fantology Five share news tidbits from the fantasy landscape, answer mailbag questions and then kick off our next bracket competition - Top Fantasy Villains. Some mild spoilers surface here, although we do our best to keep our descriptions vague. What makes a good villain, why don't we have more of them and most importantly who's rankings are best? Plus, a PSA about the dangers of consuming content at high speeds that some Fantology members have apparently ignored.
43.title: May Fantasy News + Top Fantasy Villains

44.author: Brian McClellan
44.description: The debut Powdermage book is by all accounts an impressive start for Brian McClellan. Josh & Stephen loved the characters & magic system while being fully immersed in a unique setting with non-stop action. Tune in to for our takes on the plot beats and let us know what your favorite moments were! Plus, how does the magic in Promise of Blood connect to Elon Musk's latest idea? We'll let you know.
44.title: Promise of Blood

45.author: Jim Butcher
45.description: This installment of the Dresden Files by Jim Butcher features the single best climactic scene in the entire series. Each faction in the Dresden-verse comes together for a Halloween that few will forget! Listen as Ben & Stephen break the action down and discuss some the bigger themes of the series. Plus, Harry's Tinder game - are we glad cell phones wouldn't work for him?
45.title: Dead Beat

46.author: Joe Abercrombie
46.description: There aren't any real heroes in The Heroes by Joe Abercrombie. Other than the standing stones on the hill above Osrung that is. But you have to be realistic about these things. Stephen & Ryan break down the book, tell you who went back to the mud and explain why the First Law Universe is worth your time. Plus, the finer points of grammar around Bayaz's capacity for caring about others.
46.title: The Heroes

47.author: J.K. Rowling
47.description: Harry Potter And The Prisoner Of Azkaban doesn't feature Voldemort, and we're okay with that because Sirius Black is a compelling enough villain in his own right (or is he?). Dan, Nathan & Stephen have opinions on this and every other aspect of the book, from usefulness of boggart banishing to all-time greatest Quidditch teams and everything in between. Relive book three with us! Plus, will Nathan ever move past his hatred of Ronald Weasley?
47.title: Harry Potter & The Prisoner Of Azkaban

48.author: Jim Butcher
48.description: Welcome to Splattercon!!! Home to Chicago's latest & greatest Dresden Files case. Jim Butcher continues to showcase why he's at the top of modern urban fantasy as Harry tangles with fae, denarians, vampires and forces yet unknown. Ben, Josh & Stephen break down the plot and offer our opinions on character development and some hard hitting issues the book ventures into. Plus, how old is this Harry Dresden guy anyway?
48.title: Proven Guilty

49.author: Disney+
49.description: The mud men blew it with this movie adaptation. The book material from Artemis Fowl by Eoin Colfer had plenty of material and an intricate yet compact plot, but boy did Disney screw it up on the big screen. Ben, Josh & Stephen don't mind too much though. About time we're able to do a good old fashioned roast! Plus, how many embarrassing guilty pleasure shows & movies will we admit to watching?
49.title: Artemis Fowl Movie

50.author: Robert Jordan
50.description: The Wheel of Time rolls on in this the fourth installment, The Shadow Rising by Robert Jordan. Our WoT crew is back with a review from three different perspectives & experience levels. We talk through the plot and discuss why this is often considered the best of the series. How did it changed the series as a whole? And as always we deliver our Top & Bottom 3 Character Rankings. Plus, where does Elayne Trakand fall on the hot/crazy scale?
50.title: The Shadow Rising

51.author: Fantology
51.description: The full Fantology 5 is on hand to discuss a variety of news items from June, answer mailbag questions and most importantly kick-off our next round of Top Fantasy brackets. July will feature the Top 3 Settings in Fantasy. Middle Earth, Roshar, Westeros & Randland all make appearances of course, but you probably wouldn't expect the Pokémon World to make our lists! Plus, our plan to get sent to jail and read for the rest of our lives. How crazy is that really?
51.title: Top 3 Fantasy Settings + June Fantasy News

52.author: Joe Abercrombie
52.description: The last of the First Law stand-alones by Joe Abercrombie was one of the more unique fantasy books we've explored. How often do you see a spaghetti western story disguised as a fantasy story? And how often do you see that done well? We saw it here! Red Country combines a streamlined narrative with brilliant characters and just a touch of grimdark violence. Add in some dark humor and you've got another winning First Law book! Plus, Papa Ring or Papa Roach? Help us keep characters and 2000's bands separated!
52.title: Red Country

53.author: Brandon Sanderson
53.description: In this special episode, Fantology is excited to welcome our guest stars, Cydne & Paiton, who provide a much needed female perspective in our conversation. And Mistborn is the perfect book to discuss, as Vin is arguably the seminal female protagonist of modern fantasy. We chat about her character is depth, break down opinions on the romance in the book and talk the plot and the big twist ending! Plus, if you had to pick action or romance from Mistborn, what do you do?
53.title: Mistborn: The Final Empire

54.author: Anthony Ryan
54.description: A Hero's Journey Podcast joined us to review Anthony Ryan's debut entry, Blood Song. This one features quite the hero protagonist in Vaelin Al Sorna - not someone you'd ever want to cross blades with. We break down Vaelin's story, discuss where the series is going from here and recap our favorite moments from the book. Plus, what's the better comparison here: Name of the Wind or A Song of Ice and Fire?
54.title: Blood Song

55.author: Jim Butcher
55.description: Mike's Book Reviews joins us for our review of the latest and greatest Dresden Files entry from Jim Butcher. Still fresh of the press from its release last week, Peace Talks has been somewhat divisive amongst the fanbase, with the consensus being that we'll need to wait for the follow-up entry in a couple months before a fair assessment can be made. Join us for an entertaining conversation as we break down the plot and discuss our opinions of Peace Talks! Plus, name your favorite Cheerio box Twitch streamer!
55.title: Peace Talks

56.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
56.description: Fantology goes old school with Tolkien's classic that started it all. Stephen, Ben & Josh provide some fresh takes, break down the legacy of The Lord of the Rings and draw comparisons to modern fantasy. Finally, we finish of the review with Top & Bottom 3 character rankings. Also, how many times can we mispronounce Moria, Bombadil & Galadriel?
56.title: The Fellowship of the Ring

57.author: J.K. Rowling
57.description: Voldemort is back and so are Dan and Nathan to discuss Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, the book that forever changed the landscape of the wizarding world. Join us as we discuss the organization of the Triwizard Tournament, the Bulgarian Quidditch strategy and the losers at the Yule Ball. Also, was Cho Chang really the hostage Harry should have rescued?
57.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

58.author: Jim Butcher
58.description: Harry tangles with the White Court in Jim Butcher's ninth Dresden Files novel, with explosive results. Ben & Stephen break down the novel and discuss where it ranks in the series and where the Dresdenverse is going from here. Plus, how prevalent are white court vampires? We're seeing them on hit TV shows!
58.title: White Night

59.author: Fantology
59.description: The full Fantology Five crew is back with our submissions for Top Fantasy Character Duos ft. the Weasley Twins, Frodo & Sam, and many more! We also cover news in the community from July, including Rothfuss' editor controversy, Netflix releases and The Way of Kings Kickstarter. Follow us on Twitter and watch for our request for submissions to the upcoming August tournament!
59.title: July Fantasy News + Top Fantasy Character Duos

60.author: Steven Erikson
60.description: At long last, we've made it through another Steven Erikson Malazan tome. And we loved it! Ryan, Josh & Stephen do their best to cover the plot here, but we know we aren't experts. Let us know what we missed as we prepare for Memories of Ice! Also, how many times will Stephen mispronounce Raraku and ochre: cool word or nah?
60.title: Deadhouse Gates

61.author: Brian McClellan
61.description: The Crimson Campaign is Brian McClellan's brilliant follow-up to our entry into his Powdermage universe. We loved the action, which picks up immediately and never slows down, and the fantastic characters that drive the plot along. This series has a perfect blend of other popular authors like Sanderson, Abercrombie, Martin etc. but also creates its own flavor that is equally memorable! Also, someone please tell Stephen to stop making comparisons to Deadhouse Gates!
61.title: The Crimson Campaign

62.author: Robert Jordan
62.description: The Fires of Heaven by Robert Jordan has it all: epic battles, climatic showdowns, and shocking exits. Not to mention coming of age in the Far Snows! Jake, Kaden and Stephen are once again on hand to break down the action and give you their top and bottom three characters. Plus, Perrin shines in a book he's not even really in?
62.title: The Fires of Heaven

63.author: Jim Butcher
63.description: Small Favor features our favorite of Jim Butcher's Dresden Files enemies - Nicodemus and his merry band of Denarians! This book is the cream of the crop when it comes to Chicago-style wizardry, featuring action, laughs, romance and some hard hitting dialogue on faith & fate. Plus, raise your hand if you wanted a Hummer in 2008!
63.title: Small Favor

64.author: Nickelodeon
64.description: Join Josh and a special guest star team and follow along the journey of Team Avatar! If you are on the fence about watching the show, listen to the first section to get a spoiler free description of why you should watch. If you are a long time fan stick around to hear our thoughts about the fun, emotional, and at times wacky ride that is Avatar: The Last Airbender
64.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender

65.author: Jim Butcher
65.description: Jim Butcher has hit his stride and more in Turn Coat, a masterpiece entry in the Dresden Files. Harry is once again donning his PI role, but the stakes have never been higher, and a full-scale war is on the horizon. Can we blame this all on Craigslist? Plus, check back soon for Surface Level Dresden Files Podcast's review of Animorphs!
65.title: Turn Coat

66.author: Fantology
66.description: Whether you're an avid fantasy reader that rips through novels as fast as authors can put them out, a moderate enthusiast that just finished a series and has post-book depression, or an infrequent bibliophile that hasn't touched fantasy since Harry Potter ... Fantology has your next book recommendation here! Listen in as Josh & Stephen talk through their favorite series and Iet you know why you should read them!
66.title: What You Should Read Next - Fantasy Book Recommendations

67.author: Jim Butcher
67.description: Ben, Josh & Stephen have finally made it to the Dresden Files book that changes everything - the aptly named Changes by Jim Butcher. We discuss which change was the most impactful, and which were foreshadowed the best as we break down the action and talk through the big moments of this one. Of which there were many! Plus, Stephen's strange connection to one particularly tough change.
67.title: Changes

68.author: Fantology
68.description: The full Fantology crew is here for this special monthly episode. Missed something in August? We have you covered with our fantasy news roundup. Plus, our top three fantasy artifacts competition begins soon! Here's our favorite artifacts - we'd love to hear about yours! Please submit your favorites on Twitter!
68.title: August Fantasy News + Top 3 Fantasy Artifacts

69.author: Jim Butcher
69.description: Jim Butcher's lucky 13th Dresden Files novel is one of the more divisive entries to the series. But love it or hate it, you can't deny that Ghost Story contains a hauntingly intriguing setting and the perfect emotional backdrop as the series resets itself and begins to transform from urban to epic fantasy.
69.title: Ghost Story

70.author: Joe Abercrombie
70.description: Joe Abercrombie writes short stories as well! Sharp Ends contains a snappy little bundle of short works, set in the same world as the First Law books and often providing a fresh perspective on established events and characters. Stephen & Ryan both agree: this collection is a must-read for fans of the series! Also, help Ryan name his baby. Logen, Glokta or Jezza?
70.title: Sharp Ends

71.author: Joe Abercrombie
71.description: Stephen & Alex from A Hero's Journey Podcast have zero hatred for this book! Joe Abercrombie's latest (until next week's release) completely lives up to its billing and then some. Join us for a recap before The Trouble with Peace is released. We talk through characters, plot, themes & speculation for the rest of the series. What are you expecting in the rest of the Age of Madness?
71.title: A Little Hatred

72.author: Jim Butcher
72.description: Jim Butcher has another winner in Cold Days, the 14th Dresden Files entry. Harry is once again defending Chicago from destruction, but this time with the stakes raised in epic fashion! If you thought the big blows in the series were done after Changes, you were wrong! Also, Ben is already getting post-series depression! What should he read next?
72.title: Cold Days

73.author: JK Rowling
73.description: The longest Harry Potter book earns itself in-depth coverage from Dan, Nathan & Stephen. Which Hogwarts professors have the most swag? Where did Harry & Cho go wrong? Could Fred & George be any cooler? All these questions answered, plus more!
73.title: Harry Potter And The Order Of The Phoenix

74.author: Jim Butcher
74.description: Skin Game is Jim Butcher's Dresden Files heist story - and does he ever go all in! Harry is tasked with robbing no less than the vault of Hades itself, with some questionable allies to boot. Tune in to hear how it works out for him! Plus, is parkour still cool? Was it ever?
74.title: Skin Game

75.author: Joe Abercrombie
75.description: It should be no surprise for fans of Joe Abercrombie that peace is a troubling phenomenon. Mike's Book Reviews joins Ryan & Stephen to break down the latest hit entry to the First Law universe and explain exactly why we just cannot stand for peace! We talk favorite characters, big plot events and speculation for the final entry in The Age of Madness Trilogy! Plus, the troubling plight of the fantasy book content creator!
75.title: The Trouble With Peace

76.author: Fantology
76.description: Once again the full Fantology 5 is together to discuss happenings in September, including big new book releases and TV news. Plus an exclusive look at our new intro featuring Michael Kramer and Kate Reading! Also, don't miss the start of our top fantasy creatures October Twitter poll. We give our picks here and lay out the criteria for creatures. None of this anthropomorphic garbage is allowed!
76.title: Top 3 Fantasy Creatures + September Fantasy News

77.author: Jim Butcher
77.description: The name says it all! The latest Dresden Files is indeed, a Battle Ground. Jim Butcher has expertly brought all the events of 17 books to a head, and deserves to have fun with 400 pages of action and the partial destruction of Chicago. So hey, we might as well read it too right? Plus, Utah? Nothing notable ever happens in Utah, right?
77.title: Battle Ground

78.author: JRR Tolkien
78.description: Dylan & Charles from The FTF Podcast join us to talk a classic and debate if Ents are cool or boring. The Lord of the Rings set the standard for fantasy; does it still hold up? Spoiler, yes it does. But how has it continued to be such high quality, more than 60 years after publication? Plus, check out our top and bottom 3 character performances from the book!
78.title: The Two Towers

79.author: Amazon Studios
79.description: Surprise Episode! Stephen, Ryan & Josh review Season Two of everyone's favorite irreverent superhero show from Amazon Studios, The Boys. Plus, if you or anyone you know has been exposed to Compound V, call 1-800-VOUGHT immediately. Fantology is not responsible for any supe villain damage inflicted by listening to this episode.
79.title: The Boys Season Two

80.author: Brian McClellan
80.description: Josh & Stephen wrap up our read of Brian McClellan's Powder Mage trilogy with the explosive final entry, The Autumn Republic! This series revolves around a set of fantastic characters - as a fan of the genre you NEED to meet Taniel, Tamas, Adamant, Ka-Poel & more. Plus, tier list reviews are coming...once we figure out what the letters actually mean.
80.title: The Autumn Republic

81.author: Jim Butcher
81.description: We should have read the short stories first! Apologies to the entire Dresdenverse. Side Jobs by Jim Butcher is a fantastic extra helping of the Dresden Files, complete with new perspectives and viewpoints. It's a necessary read for any magical residents of Chicago. Plus, why Stephen's childhood fear of Carrie was well-founded!
81.title: Side Jobs

82.author: Jim Butcher
82.description: We're doubling down on the short stories with Brief Cases by Jim Butcher. This entry in the Dresden Files features some never before seen points of view and plenty of behind the scenes content. All in all, this is a must read for any Dresden fan. Plus, Stephen flexes his hairline and Ben admits to nefarious proclivities!
82.title: Brief Cases

83.author: Robert Jordan
83.description: Let the Lord of Chaos rule! The sixth book of The Wheel of Time settles us in for the long haul in the series - and we aren't even halfway through yet. This may be the highest climax in all of Robert Jordan's works and we absolutely loved it! Plus, Jake's expanding vocabulary and Stephen's obsession with Hamilton.
83.title: Lord of Chaos

84.author: JK Rowling
84.description: Dan, Nathan & Stephen are back in the Wizarding World, covering Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (spoiler: it's Severus Snape). JK Rowling transitions us into the Endgame in this one, with stakes that have never been higher. From awkward teenage romances to death eater conspiracy theories, book 6 spans the full range Harry Potter experiences. Plus our top & bottom 3 character rankings!
84.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

85.author: Fantology
85.description: 4/5th of Fantology is on-hand to kick off November's Top 3 Fantasy Book Covers Competition and recap fantasy happenings from October. Interested in Dresden Files releases, internet rankings of Top Fantasy Books and Series and our attempts to use technology to show you book covers? You won't want to miss this episode!
85.title: Top 3 Fantasy Book Covers + October Fantasy News

86.author: Evan Winter
86.description: About time we got to this one!  The Rage of Dragons is one of the hottest new books in the fantasy world - does it live up to the hype? Find out in our non-spoiler review and jump in our hot takes in the full spoiler episode. Plus, our circus of mispronounced words - please forgive us!
86.title: The Rage of Dragons

87.author: Jim Butcher
87.description: Our first tier list episode covers all 19 of Jim Butcher's published Dresden works - you won't want to miss this one if you're a fan of the series! Stephen & Ben debate their rankings of the books and come to a (somewhat) peaceful consensus. Plus, let us know what tiers you want to see next!
87.title: Dresden Files Tier List Rankings

88.author: Brandon Sanderson
88.description: The biggest event of 2020 is almost upon us! Brandon Sanderson is attempting to redeem this awful year with 1200+ pages of goodness otherwise known as Rhythm of War. And we're getting you ready for this tome with a recap of the series up to this point. Let us know what you want to happen next in the Stormlight Archive!
88.title: Rhythm of War Primer

89.author: Brandon Sanderson
89.description: Need a refresher on the 1200+ pages preceding Rhythm of War? Here's our review and recap of the many, many events of Oathbringer. And this book wasn't just about quantity either - the quality and epic awesomeness of these moments just cannot be overstated. So hey, sounds like we liked the book! Plus, our Harry Potter & Lord of the Rings Stormlight Archive crossovers!
89.title: Oathbringer

90.author: Brandon Sanderson
90.description: In all seriousness, this is a strong episode. Dawnshard focuses on a paraplegic character, so Stephen opens up about his experience with paralysis and Brandon Sanderson's fantastic disability representation. Plus, did we mention this is a Stormlight novella? There are mind-blowing cosmere ramifications here! Don't forget to read this novella before Rhythm of War.
90.title: Dawnshard

91.author: Brandon Sanderson
91.description: It's finally here! As promised, Fantology will be reviewing all five parts of the latest entry to the Stormlight Archive. We discuss the climactic opening, the quality of the villain cast, and most importantly: our theories for the rest of the book. Plus, Ben tries to make Papa Dal a thing. Yay or nay?
91.title: Rhythm of War Part One

92.author: Brandon Sanderson
92.description: A few hundred pages later, we've completed part two and are that much closer to our destination. If you're along the journey with us, tune in to hear our opinions and theories. Stephen & Ryan talk everything from Bondsmith conjecture to Shallon's character representation and a suprising yet inevitable speculation on her dark past. Plus, we name our part two MVP and top & bottom moments!
92.title: Rhythm of War Part Two

93.author: Brandon Sanderson
93.description: We're well into Rhythm of War by now, and plot threads are everywhere! Sanderson is expertly juggling his characters and all we can do is try to keep up until the Sanderlanche begins. Tune in to hear our hot (and cold) takes, theories and our top and bottom moments in part three. Plus, which character is the AOC of Roshar?
93.title: Rhythm of War Part Three

94.author: Fantology
94.description: What kind of fantasy book reader isn't a sucker for a good map? The full Fantology 5 is here for this episode to present our top fantasy maps and kick of December's Twitter competition. Let us know your top maps & compete for fabulous prizes! Plus, November news featuring a little book written by Sanderson, TV adaptation updates, corporate greed and an update from Patrick Rothfuss!
94.title: Top 3 Fantasy Maps + November Fantasy News

95.author: Brandon Sanderson
95.description: As the Sanderlanche approaches the Fantology crew embraces our Taravangian-ish role to pause our read in order to review part four. How much of this setup will pay off in part five? What are we expecting for the conclusion? And who have our favorite characters been thus far? Plus, Stephen's apology to Dabbid, who he had previously forgotten the existence of.
95.title: Rhythm of War Part Four

96.author: Brandon Sanderson
96.description: What. A. Ride. Part Five had everything we needed and was the perfect payoff for the end of this 1200+ page tome. Fists pumped! Guts punched! Evil slain! Stephen, Ben and Josh break down the ends of our favorite characters arcs and talk our theories, hopes and dreams for book five. Which really can't come soon enough. Plus, watch for a discussion that includes a Mistborn spoiler at 50 something. We give an ample warning in the audio as well, so you should be safe.
96.title: Rhythm of War Part Five

97.author: Fantology
97.description: We were honored to participate in the inagural #WoTaHoliday Charity Livestream, which raised over $5,000 over the course of 24 hours of brilliance from Wheel of Time content creators. For our segment we stole Wheel of Time Characters and sorted them into Knights Radiant Orders and Houses from A Song of Ice And Fire & Harry Potter. Tune in to see where your favorite characters have landed!
97.title: Wheel of Time Characters...In Other Series

98.author: Brandon Sanderson
98.description: This is the Rhythm of War Review that you've been waiting for! Fantology bids farewell to the book that has consumed our last five months with some final comprehensive coverage. We talk our fist-pump moments and speculate on the upcoming book five finale. Plus, a shocking theory about Odium's champion that seems just terrible enough to be true.
98.title: Rhythm of War Full Spoiler Review

99.author: Disney+
99.description: Andy aka CubsFan Han, was kind enough to come by and tell us about the current Star Wars landscape and pump up some major excitement for the upcoming projects. We also review season two of The Mandalorian and get an expert breakdown of the music and connections to other Star Wars media. Plus, have you watched Clone Wars and Rebels? Because we really, really need to apparently!
99.title: The Mandalorian Season Two

100.author: Fantology
100.description: We've hit the century mark! Fantology celebrates 100 fantastic episode with a review of the 2020 year in books and other SFF news. Our favorite reads get exactly what they were hoping for - a tier list treatment! Check out how we rate our reads of the year, plus see what we're looking ahead to in the 2021 year in fantasy.
100.title: Best Reads of 2020

101.author: JK Rowling
101.description: The end is near. We've split book 7 in half and Dan, Nathan & Stephen are once again here with our penultimate review, chalk full of hot takes and inevitable mistakes. Are Dobby & Hedwig emotional departures? Do we forgive Ron? Would the Weasley family wear masks in 2020? All these questions answered, plus more in our top and bottom 3 character ratings. Tune in!
101.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1

102.author: R.F. Kuang
102.description: Beautifully brutal, The Dragon Republic is a must-read for any fan of the genre. R.F. Kuang builds on her debut, The Poppy War with a strong follow-up novel that expands her world and exacerbates the conflict. Stephen & Ben give their review here and talk through favorite characters and moments. Plus, Rin: swipe left or swipe right?
102.title: The Dragon Republic

103.author: Stephen King
103.description: It might have taken a few long months of pandemic season, but we made it all the way through Stephen King's The Stand. Check out our review below where Jake and Josh talk through the large cast of characters and compare King's pandemic to ours. Plus, we wanted more meat back on the menu!
103.title: The Stand

104.author: JK Rowling
104.description: We hate to see it end, but also still enjoy the finale Harry Potter all these years later. Dan, Nathan and Stephen provide their takes on the end of The Deathly Hallows and create top & bottom character rankings for the final time. Plus, Stephen's British accent and the discovery of the real reason that Hermione and Ron are a questionable couple.
104.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2

105.author: Anthony Ryan
105.description: Anthony Ryan kicks off a new duology starring everyone's favorite Brother of the Sixth Order, Vaelin Al Sorna, with The Wolf's Call. Stephen, Ryan and Jake talk through the plot and our favorite characters, including some controversial decisions. Plus, what do Vaelin Al Sorna and Michael Scott's vasectomy have in common?
105.title: The Wolf's Call

106.author: Evan Winter
106.description: Full spoilers this time! Everyone's favorite ball of unstoppable gladiatorial fury, Tau Solarin, is back in Fires of Vengeance, Book 2 of The Burning by Evan Winter. Tune in to see what we loved and what we wanted to obliterate with a dual sword strike from Isihogo.
106.title: The Fires of Vengeance

107.author: Fantology
107.description: What are your favorite romances from SFF books? Fantology is unveiling ours and appropriately devoting February to let everyone compete on Twitter to find out which fantasy romances are the strongest. Plus, fantasy news from January and regular old fantasies from Josh!
107.title: Top 3 Fantasy Romances + January News

108.author: Ernest Cline
108.description: We can't recommend reading this book. But if you have already, here's a rant that might make you feel better.
108.title: Ready Player Two

109.author: Frank Herbert
109.description: Dune is a classic. One of the founding fathers of the science fiction genre. How does Frank Herbert's creation hold up today? Find out in our review!
109.title: Dune

110.author: J.K. Rowling
110.description: The showdown episodes in the making. Stephen, Nathan and Dan compete for the title of ultimate Potterhead in the first part of our trivia showdown. Play along with us! There's a non-zero chance that your Harry Potter knowledge is much more impressive than ours.
110.title: Harry Potter Trivia Part One

111.author: R.F. Kuang
111.description: Charles and Dylan from FTF Podcast join Ben and Stephen to cover The Burning God from all angles. We talk Rin and the making of a monster against the backdrop of speculative Chinese history. Plus, our attempted answers to the philosophical questions R.F. Kuang asks in the series and who's interested in The Poppy War: A Musical?
111.title: The Burning God

112.author: Fantology
112.description: Part two concludes our first trivia episode. Will Stephen hold his lead? Will Nathan overtake his older brother? Will Dan find his way onto the scoreboard? Play along with us and test your Harry Potter knowledge!
112.title: Harry Potter Trivia Part Two

113.author: Fantology
113.description: What magic is the best magic? We debate. And let us know your top magic systems on Twitter! Plus, we cover news from February including an update from George R.R. Martin, Wheel of Time on Prime and news from new authors.
113.title: Top 3 Fantasy Romances + January News

114.author: Marvel
114.description: Our Marvel expert Doug makes his first guest appearance as we break down Wandavision and upcoming Marvel projects. Theories abound. Superheroes are back baby!
114.title: Wandavision

115.author: Robert Jordan
115.description: Kaden is still going strong through his first read of Wheel of Time. Add in Jake's expert perspective and whatever it is Stephen brings to the episode and you have a review of A Crown of Swords! Plus, check out who the guys picked for their Top and Bottom 3 characters.
115.title: A Crown of Swords

116.author: Ana Lal Din
116.description: Ana Lal Din was kind enough to join us for our first in our special series - The Author's Voice. Ana is releasing her debut novel, The Descent of the Drowned, an #ownvoices tale that explores culture, abuse and the strength of humanity. Plus there's magic! Check out the book and support our authors!
116.title: The Descent of the Drowned

117.author: Randall McNally
117.description: Randall McNally connected with Stephen to talk about Shadowless, his self-published and uniquely brilliant epic fantasy book. We talk about his writing process and experience in the publishing market while convincing you to try out the book!
117.title: Shadowless

118.author: Daniel Greene
118.description: Double Coverage of Breach of Peace! If you haven't read Daniel Greene's novella yet, then check out our no spoiler conversation. Already listened? Tune into our roundtable discussion of our favorite moments and ratings.
118.title: Breach of Peace

119.author: Joe Abercrombie
119.description: Jake has finally started The First Law! Stephen joins him to talk about the beginning of Joe Abercrombie's fantastic grimdark series and discuss theories and favorite characters. Why do we do this again?
119.title: The Blade Itself

120.author: Brandon Sanderson
120.description: Stephen's roommate Daniel took the plunge into epic fantasy, so we took the opportunity to revisit the beginning of the Stormlight Archive with him. Tune in for a first time perspective on the beginning of Brandon Sanderson's magnum opus!
120.title: The Way of Kings...Revisited

121.author: Fantology
121.description: Who are the best sidekick characters in SFF? All five Fantology members give their picks and now request to hear from you! Plus, news in March including new Abercrombie and Wheel of Time on Prime speculation.
121.title: Top 3 Sidekick Characters + March SFF News

122.author: Jim Butcher
122.description: Stephen and Ryan revisit the entirety of Jim Butcher's Dresden Files (with full spoilers). We get Ryan's tier list rankings for the books and retrospective thoughts on the series as a whole. Is it really urban fantasy? Or epic fantasy in disguise?
122.title: The Dresden Files, Full Series Retrospective

123.author: Brandon Sanderson
123.description: We welcome Alex & Zach from A Hero's Journey Podcast to talk through Elantris. Tune in for our discussion of how Sanderson's writing and the Cosmere itself has progressed since the adventures of Raoden, Sarene & Hrathen. Brandon Sanderson's first published work isn't one to skip!
123.title: Elantris ft. A Hero's Journey

124.author: Robert Jordan
124.description: Stephen, Jake and first-time reader Kaden continue their trek through the Wheel of Time in book 8, The Path of Daggers! We talk the momentum of the series, favorite character moments and debate when the slog begins. Plus, who would you want by your side on a deserted island in the Aryth Ocean?
124.title: The Path of Daggers

125.author: Stephen King
125.description: Ben and Josh, our resident team of twins, team up on this review of early Stephen King. How does The Eyes of the Dragon compare to other King fantasy? Tune in a find out! Ten minutes of no spoiler conversation, followed by a full book review.
125.title: The Eyes of the Dragon

126.author: John Gwynne
126.description: Release day episode! Stephen and Josh cover John Gwynne's latest hit in depth, starting with a no-spoiler discussion. If you're interested in The Shadow of the Gods, we'll let you know what you're in for and if you've finished already tune into the latter half of the episode for our spoiler takes.
126.title: The Shadow of the Gods

127.author: Fantology
127.description: Fantology's May competition will pay tribute to the mothers of SFF. Who are your Top 3 Moms in the genre? Tune in for our picks, plus a recap of a busy month of April.
127.title: Top 3 Mothers + April SFF News

128.author: Adrian Tchaikovsky
128.description: Two for one special! Jake and Ryan review two outstanding Adrian Tchaikovsky works as Fantology finally ventures into science fiction. No spoilers at first to give curious listeners a taste of the books, followed by a full spoiler discussion for experienced fans.
128.title: Children of Time + Children of Ruin

129.author: George R.R. Martin
129.description: Welcome vampires and cattle alike to the Antebellum South! Zack from MiddleFantasy was kind enough to join Stephen and Ben to discuss Fevre Dream, an early George R.R. Martin timepiece novel. How does it hold up today? What similarities do we see to A Song of Ice And Fire? Tune in and find out!
129.title: Fevre Dream

130.author: Christopher Buehlman
130.description: The Blacktongue Thief is a hilarious romp of moral ambiguity. We follow the first person narrative of Kinch, a thief brilliantly assembled from every trope of the class, on an epic adventure across a Dungeons and Dragons inspired world. Tune in for an extended non-spoiler discussion for why you should buy the book, followed by a spoilerific plot breakdown.
130.title: The Blacktongue Thief

131.author: Joe Abercrombie
131.description: Tune in for Jake's first-time impressions of Joe Abercrombie's second First Law entry and Stephen's fanboy opinions. Before They Are Hanged is a masterpiece of trope subversion. How exactly did Abercrombie craft this one?
131.title: Before They Are Hanged

132.author: Fantology
132.description: Bad reviews! Top Sci-Fi and Fantasy Dads! Fantasy News! What more could you want? Tune in to hear Stephen, Jake and Josh break down the month of May 2021.
132.title: Top 3 SFF Fathers + May Fantasy News

133.author: Robert Jordan
133.description: Our first-time reader Kaden has made it through Winter's Heart. Through nine books now, Jake and Stephen get his take on the 'slog' and his excitement on where the series is going. Plus, polygamy, taint and the politics of Andor. Not to mention our tradition top and bottom character rankings!
133.title: Winter's Heart

134.author: Benny Hinrichs
134.description: Looking for something new? Check out Orluvoq by Benny Hinrichs! Just released yesterday, Orluvoq combines a unique Inuit inspired world with compelling characters and themes to create a memorable tale. Tune in to hear Benny tell us about his process, the inspiration for the book and his experience establishing himself as an author.
134.title: Orluvoq

135.author: Mark Lawrence
135.description: Prince of Thorns was our first Mark Lawrence book, and definitely not our last! This one spawned an interesting review and discussion of morality and whether we could cheer for Jorg despite his despicable actions.
135.title: Prince of Thorns

136.author: Fantology
136.description: Fantology runs the gauntlet in this episode. Stephen, Ryan, Ben and Josh start with our picks for Top 3 SFF Animal Companions, then briefly touch on top news and reviews from June and finish up with our first debate segment. Do authors owe their fans completed series?
136.title: Top 3 Animal Companions + Debate! Do Authors Owe Readers?

137.author: Stephen King
137.description: Ben and Josh feature on a special twin episode, covering the first two books of The Dark Tower. Interested in the Stephen King fantasy multiverse, or just reading King in general? We have you covered. Plus a deep dive plot review into both books!
137.title: The Gunslinger & The Drawing of the Three

138.author: Stephen King
138.description: Ben and Josh are back with more Stephen King. Pet Sematary may well be his most terrifying book ever - what makes this one so seriously messed up? Tune in for our takes on the exploration of death and whether or not this one might be for you.
138.title: Pet Sematary
